alert.note: Alert for Buffalo (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 4:34AM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in La Crosse WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota...Wisconsin... Mississippi River Near Alma Dam 4 affecting Buffalo and Wabasha Counties. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River Near Alma Dam 4. * WHEN...From Sunday morning until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM CDT Friday the stage was 15.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Sunday morning and continue rising to a crest of 16.9 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.3 feet on 04/18/1952. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 445 PM CDT.
